panels.description: Percent of HTTP responses not 5xx, as a moving average over the last 24 hours. 503 from webserver is ignored because it's expected when the airflow webserver is coming up.
panels.title: Platform Availability

panels.description: The percent of responses with code 5xx as a percent of total requests , categorized by response code, measured every five minutes. 503 from webserver is ignored because it's expected when the airflow webserver is coming up.
panels.title: Server Errors

panels.description: The percent of total requests that error with 4xx, categorized by response code, measured every five minutes
panels.title: Client Errors

panels.description: The 99th percentile of response times should be less than 1 second. The line shows the average over the past 24 hours.
panels.title: Platform Latency

panels.description: Where are the 99th percentile of latency requests coming from?
panels.title: Slow requests

panels.description: How many requests are being handled per second, averaged over one minute.
panels.title: Request rate

panels.description: How many requests have been handled in the past 24 hours. This is useful to monitor platform growth.
panels.title: 1-day Request volume

panels.description: The average task success rate, categorized by percentile. For example, p50 means the success rate of the healthier half of the deployments, sorted by success rate. p100 means just the healthiest deployment. p0 means the average of all deployments.
panels.title: Airflow Task Success Rate

panels.description: The number of tasks that have run in the past 24 hours, categorized by success and failure. This does not account for the size or duration of tasks, but is still kind of useful for monitoring growth.
panels.title: 1-day Airflow Task Volume

panels.description: The percent of Airflow schedulers that have received a heartbeat in the past 1 minute
panels.title: Airflow Scheduler Health

panels.description: The deployments which do not have healthy schedulers.
panels.title: Unhealthy Schedulers

panels.description: The average time to parse a DAG, categorized by percentile. For example, p50 means the bottom half of the deployments, sorted by parsing duration. p100 means just the deployment with the fastest average DAG parsing time. p0 means the average of all DAG parsing times. It is normalized across deployments, so each deployment has the same impact on the average, regardless of the number of DAGs a deployment has.
panels.title: DAG Parsing Time

panels.description: The number of Airflow webservers that have restarted in the past five minutes, categorized by namespace
panels.title: Airflow Webserver Restarts

panels.description: The number of DAG parsing timeouts in the past 5 minutes
panels.title: DAG Parsing timeouts

panels.description: At any given time, list the 5 deployments with the slowest average DAG parsing time
panels.title: 5 Slowest DAG Parsing Deployments

panels.description: The number of currently active connections to the database
panels.title: Database Connections

panels.description: The number of active clients, by deployment
panels.title: PG Bouncer Active Clients

panels.description: The number of waiting clients, by deployment
panels.title: PG Bouncer Waiting Clients
